title: About Me

hero.post: a Teacher and Education Technology Designer.

articleBody:
I design and develop educational programs in the LLND (Language Literacy, Numeracy and Digital) department at the Canberra Institute of Technology (CIT). I have taught English as a Second Language (ESL) and now EAL (English as an Additional Language) in the AMEP program both at the CIT and AMES in Victoria for over a decade. I have worked as an education designer at CIT in a team, leading the Innovative Learning Resources project as part of CITâ€™s Strategic Compass 2020 initiative.

My passion for language teaching, eLearning and instructional design and technology has enabled me to develop innovative online courses and resources for a range of education projects with a focus on consistent, functional and bite-size learning design to facilitate learner engagement and rich learning experiences.

Additionally, I am a big supporter of open source and love learning about web technologies. As a result, in my spare time I contibue to an open source project called Plenti - a Build-Time Render (BTR) Engine using a Svelte frontend and Go backend and an integrated, Git-backed CMS. Also, since 2017, I have been a keen enthusiast, supporter and promoter of H5P Technology and this year I proudly became a H5P Embassador.
